intro: Myrocarpus, commonly known as the Brazil nut tree, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its thick, woody trunk and dense canopy. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, woody pods containing the edible Brazil nuts. Its leaves are compound, with alternate arrangement, and it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
